Overview.Summary: The 2022 Albanian presidential election was held on June 4, 2022, with Bajram Begaj, chief of staff of the Albanian Armed Forces, being elected as the new president by the Parliament of Albania (1, 2, 3, 6). The election came after three rounds of voting where no candidates were nominated (2, 7). Begaj, who was congratulated by Russian President Vladimir Putin (8), will replace the incumbent president, Ilir Meta, on July 25, 2022 (6).

Timeline.Text: Bajram Begaj, chief of staff of the Albanian Armed Forces, is elected as the new president of Albania by the country's parliament.
Vladimir Putin, the President of Russia, congratulates Bajram Begaj on his election as the new president of Albania.
The 2017 Albanian presidential election, in which no candidates were proposed and no vote took place in the Parliament of Albania, is referenced in relation to the current election.
The Albanian Parliament fails to elect a president in the first round of voting.
Bujar Nishani, the former president of Albania, passes away at the age of 55.
Bajram Begaj receives congratulations from several European and regional leaders on his election as the new president of Albania.
Volodymyr Zelensky, the President of Ukraine, addresses the Albanian Parliament through the Zoom platform.

Overview.Summary: Ferdinand Marcos Jr. has been declared the winner of the 2022 Philippine presidential election (1,3,8,9). The incumbent president, Aleksandar Vucic, also claimed victory in Serbia's presidential election (2,4). The election in the Philippines was held on May 9, 2022 (7,9) and Marcos Jr. received a landslide victory (8). The death of President Umaru Yar'Adua in 2010 gave his vice president, Goodluck Jonathan, the right to become the next president (5). The election was also contested by Manny Pacquiao, who finished third (3).

Timeline.Text: Serbia's incumbent President Aleksandar Vucic declares a landslide victory in the country's presidential election.
Ferdinand Marcos Jr. wins the presidential election in the Philippines.
The namesake son of late Philippine dictator Ferdinand Marcos wins the presidential election by a landslide.
Manny Pacquiao concedes defeat in the Philippine presidential election, finishing third.
Results show that Ferdinand Marcos Jr. is expected to win the Philippine presidential election in a landslide.
Ferdinand Marcos Jr. wins the overseas Filipino vote in the presidential election.

Overview.Summary: The 2022 Albanian presidential election was held on May 16, 2022 (3) but no candidates were nominated in the first round of voting (3). In the third round of voting, a top military official was elected as the country's new president (4). The election was not free, honest, or fair according to independent monitoring (9). Other elections in 2022 also saw significant wins for independent candidates, such as in the Bangkok governor's election (6) and the Lebanese election (8).

Timeline.Text: Albania elects a top military official as its new president after no candidates were nominated in three rounds of voting.
Former rebel Gustavo Petro narrowly wins the runoff election to become Colombia's first leftist president.
The Albanian parliament fails to elect a president in the first round of voting, with no candidates nominated.
The Lebanese election sees significant gains for independent non-sectarian politicians.
Residents of Bangkok, Thailand, elect Chadchart Sittipunt, an independent politician, as their city's governor.
Misinformation and manipulated media are already being circulated as campaigning begins for Kenya's elections.
Prime Minister Edi Rama congratulates top military official Bajram Begaj on his election as Albania's new president.
The International Coalition for Human Rights in the Philippines finds massive fraud in the country's elections.
Nobel laureate Jose Ramos-Horta wins a landslide victory in East Timor's presidential election.
The Turkish presidential election goes to a run-off for the first time in the country's history.

Overview.Summary: The 2022 Albanian presidential election is scheduled for June 29, 2022 (1). It will involve members of both the Rajya Sabha and Lok Sabha (1). The incumbent president is eligible for re-election, but faces competition from Abdul Latif Rashid (2). In the Philippines, the presidential election is set for May 9, 2022 (4,5,9). Bongbong Marcos, son of ousted president Ferdinand Marcos, is a leading candidate (4,5). In Turkey, the presidential election is set for June 2023 (6). In Australia, the election is scheduled for May 20, 2022 (8). And in France, Emmanuel Macron is projected to win the presidential election on April 24, 2022 (10).

Timeline.Text: The Philippines holds their presidential election.
The results of the Philippine presidential race are announced, with Bongbong Marcos winning by a landslide.
Millions of Australians vote in their country's federal election.
The Electoral College elects the Vice-President of India for a four-year term.
Presidential elections are held in Turkey, with a run-off between two candidates for the first time in Turkish history.
Emmanuel Macron is projected to win the French presidential election.

Overview.Summary: The 2022 Albanian presidential election is set to take place on June 16 (1). The election process is a constitutional one, and the newly elected president will replace Ilir Meta (6). Bajram Begaj, a former Chief of General Staff of the Albanian Armed Forces, was elected as the new president with 78 votes in favor (7). There were no candidates nominated in three rounds of voting, leading to a failed first vote (10). The election has been a topic of political contention and disagreement (4, 9).

Bajram Begaj, a former Chief of General Staff of the Albanian Armed Forces, is elected as the new president of Albania.
Bajram Begaj is confirmed as the new president of Albania and is set to take office on July 25, 2022.

Overview.Summary: The 2022 Albanian presidential election took place between May and June 2022 (1,2,4,6,7,8,9,10). Bajram Begaj, a former Chief of General Staff of the Albanian Armed Forces, was elected as the new president with 78 votes in favor (4,7,8). The election was held after the death of former President Bujar Nishani at the age of 55 (3,5). The election was closely watched by European and regional leaders, including Russian President Vladimir Putin (6).

Timeline.Text: The first round of the Albanian presidential election fails due to all parties failing to agree on a candidate.
Former Albanian President Bujar Nishani dies at 55.
Bajram Begaj, a top military official, is elected as the new President of Albania.
Indirect presidential elections continue in Albania.
Russian President Vladimir Putin congratulates Bajram Begaj on his election as President of Albania.

Overview.Summary: In 2022, Bajram Begaj, the chief of staff of the Albanian Armed Forces, was elected as the new president of Albania (1,2,4,6). This was a significant event in the country's political landscape (1,2,4,6). The election was held by the country's parliament (1,2,4,6). This was not the only important presidential election in 2022, as the Philippines also held a presidential election (5,9,13,14,15,16,19,20). In this election, Ferdinand Marcos Jr. appeared to have won by a landslide, sparking controversy due to his family's history and allegations of cheating (9,13,14,15,16). Other notable presidential elections in 2022 included those in Iraq, Turkey, and Serbia (10,11,12,18). However, the Iraqi election was largely ceremonial as the country operates under a parliamentary system (10). In addition to national presidential elections, there were also elections for the vice-president of India (8) and the IDF Chief of the General Staff in Israel (3). Overall, 2022 was a significant year for presidential elections around the world, with notable changes in leadership and political controversy.

Timeline.Text: Bajram Begaj, chief of staff of the Albanian Armed Forces, is elected president by the Parliament in Tirana, Albania.
Eligibility for the Indian presidential election is discussed.
The Israeli Defense Forces appoint Major General Herzi Halevi as the 23rd Chief of the General Staff.
Goodluck Jonathan becomes the President of Nigeria after the death of Umaru Yar'Adua.
Ferdinand Marcos Jr. is elected as the next President of the Philippines.
Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic is re-elected.
The Iraqi presidential election is held, with Barham Salih beaten by Abdul Latif Rashid.
Colombia's presidential election goes to a runoff.
The Constitutional Council of France proclaims Emmanuel Macron as the President of France.
Turkey holds both presidential and parliamentary elections.
